CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Offer Accepted stage positioned above or below the Phone Screen stage?
SRP.A: The Offer Accepted stage is positioned {below} the Phone Screen stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage HR Interview?
VE.A: The value of stage HR Interview is {68%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Offer Extended?
VE.A: The value of stage Offer Extended is {36%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Technical Interview?
VE.A: The value of stage Technical Interview is {51%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Application Submitted, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Offer Accepted, with a value of {22%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Phone Screen to stage HR Interview?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Phone Screen to stage HR Interview is {15%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Technical Interview to stage Offer Extended?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Technical Interview to stage Offer Extended is {15%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Application Submitted to stage Phone Screen?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Application Submitted to stage Phone Screen is {17%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 91%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 43%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Offer Extended} stage has {36%}, the {Offer Accepted} stage has {22%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 43% and 59%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Application Submitted to Phone Screen, or from stage Technical Interview to Offer Extended?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Application Submitted} to {Phone Screen} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Phone Screen to HR Interview, from stage Technical Interview to Offer Extended, or from stage Offer Extended to Offer Accepted?
NC.A: The reductions from stage {Phone Screen} to {HR Interview}, {Technical Interview} to {Offer Extended}, and {Offer Extended} to {Offer Accepted} are equal.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Application Submitted} and {Phone Screen} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Offer Extended} and {Offer Accepted} stages.
